commit_message:
Remove obsolete code of urlparse importing

Python 2.5 is not supported anymore, urlparse is useless in
keystoneclient/httpclient.py file.

keystoneclient is depended by a dozen othere projects, "import urlparse"
will induce py33 issue in these projects.

So, clear it up.

Close-Bug #1239956

Change-Id: I76b00f9594a52f4826c0c66eca58210755afd9ba

subject: Don't zero out thin provisioned LV's on delete
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2243, 'name': 'John Griffith', 'email': 'john.griffith8@gmail.com', 'username': 'john-griffith'}, {'_account_id': 2759, 'name': 'Huang Zhiteng', 'email': 'winston.d@gmail.com', 'username': 'zhiteng-huang'}, {'_account_id': 4355, 'name': 'Avishay Traeger', 'email': 'avishay@stratoscale.com', 'username': 'avishay-il'}, {'_account_id': 7051, 'name': 'Swapnil Kulkarni', 'email': 'skulkarn@redhat.com', 'username': 'swapnilkulkarni2608'}, {'_account_id': 8574, 'name': 'Qin Zhao', 'username': 'zhaoqin', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-16 01:41:15.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Don't zero out thin provisioned LV's on delete

Thin provisioned LV's don't need secure delete to protect
from data leakage.  Also, zeroing these out kinda defeats
the purpose of using thing provisioning.

This patch add a check for the lvm type and if it's thin simply
skips the call to lvm.clear_volume()

Change-Id: Ie6764209018152565295291efc6fbba553698ae6
Closes-Bug: #1240299
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-16 03:14:08.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': "Don't zero out thin provisioned LV's on delete

Thin provisioned LV's don't need secure delete to protect
from data leakage.  Also, zeroing these out kinda defeats
the purpose of using thing provisioning.

This patch add a check for the lvm type and if it's thin simply
returns from the lvm.clear_volume() method.

Change-Id: Ie6764209018152565295291efc6fbba553698ae6
Closes-Bug: #1240299
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Don't zero out thin provisioned LV's on delete

Thin provisioned LV's don't need secure delete to protect
from data leakage.  Also, zeroing these out kinda defeats
the purpose of using thing provisioning.

This patch add a check for the lvm type and if it's thin simply
returns from the lvm.clear_volume() method.

Change-Id: Ie6764209018152565295291efc6fbba553698ae6
Closes-Bug: #1240299

commit_message:
Nexenta NFS volume driver folder auto sharing

1. Auto sharing for NFS enclosing folders, this helps to avoid errors if user
forgot to share enclosing directory.

2. Added version history to NexentaNfsDriver doc string.

Change-Id: I9aa2a7b8760c687985aa11d85715188f1c1622f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-08-08 10:02:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Cancel an ongoing server snapshot

During an instance snapshot, the instance can be stuck in particular
task state when the image uploading takes time or restart of compute
during the snapshot. This would prevent users from taking any further
action on the instance like a resize or rebuild.

The os-server-image-cancel extension exposes an endpoint to cancel an
ongoing server snapshot. As part of the cancel, the instance task state
would be set to 'None', image deleted from glance and the image
uploading would be cancelled if started. This functionality has been
implemented for xenserver only.

Implements: blueprint cancel-an-ongoing-image

Change-Id: I217b16479e5fda6195ffa974310daa04d124cb4b

commit_message:
Cancel an ongoing server snapshot

During an instance snapshot, the instance can be stuck in particular
task state when the image uploading takes time or restart of compute
during the snapshot. This would prevent users from taking any further
action on the instance like a resize or rebuild.

The os-server-image-cancel extension exposes an endpoint to cancel an
ongoing server snapshot. As part of the cancel, the instance task state
would be set to 'None', image deleted from glance and the image
uploading would be cancelled if started. This functionality has been
implemented for xenserver only.

Implements: blueprint cancel-an-ongoing-image

Change-Id: I217b16479e5fda6195ffa974310daa04d124cb4b

commit_message:
Fix baremetal volume driver to work

To get fixed-ips for the instance, it uses network API instead of
DB API. Also updated to suit underlying LibVirt iSCSI volume driver.

Also adds tests for the volume driver.

Change-Id: Ia6198c864bd25c3189cd533154bb383ab68c5060
Closes-Bug: #1208707

subject: Interface-attach: properly refresh cache
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-11 19:06:46.000000000', 'files': ['nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'message': "Interface-attach: properly refresh cache

Since commit 394c693e359ed4f19cc2f7d975b1f9ee5500b7f6 ,
allocate_port_for_instance() has been returning only the latest allocated port,
instead of __all__ the allocated ports. Its return value is used to refresh the
cache (thanks to the 'refresh_cache' decorator), thus leading said cache to
hold wrong data.

This patch makes _get_instance_nw_info() refresh the cache, and removes the
decorator from both allocate_port_for_instance() and allocate_for_instance() to
fix the issue. The deallocate_port_for_instance() method therefore does not
need this decorator any more, so remove it as well.

Change-Id: I02fc0ee3fcfb01fa473fb8d899d8349143e55b3e
Closes-Bug: #1223859
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Interface-attach: properly refresh cache

Since commit 394c693e359ed4f19cc2f7d975b1f9ee5500b7f6 ,
allocate_port_for_instance() has been returning only the latest allocated port,
instead of __all__ the allocated ports. Its return value is used to refresh the
cache (thanks to the 'refresh_cache' decorator), thus leading said cache to
hold wrong data.

This patch makes _get_instance_nw_info() refresh the cache, and removes the
decorator from both allocate_port_for_instance() and allocate_for_instance() to
fix the issue. The deallocate_port_for_instance() method therefore does not
need this decorator any more, so remove it as well.

Change-Id: I02fc0ee3fcfb01fa473fb8d899d8349143e55b3e
Closes-Bug: #1223859

commit_message:
remove skip-networking from my.cnf file

This patch will modify the my.cnf file to turn off the option
skip-networking.  If skip-networking is on then devstack will be
unable to connect to the mysql server as it does so through TCP
sockets.

Change-Id: I5424d12b2a4e27c3272878e4bfeb99290aaca633
Closes-Bug: #1236740

commit_message:
Add port bindings to ports created in Midonet

Currently Midokura uses its own script (mm-ctl) to bind ports. However, support
for using this script is left out of the nova and neutron projects. This causes
confusion and makes deployments unnecessarily complicated for customers using
Havana. This fix is to change Neutron to properly set up port bindings to use
the "midonet" vif driver when creating a port. Corresponding changes will be
submitted to the devstack and Nova projects.

Change-Id: I91f2e4fe7135da0c22fb408081efdc63fff748df
Closes-Bug: 1235134

subject: Fix lvm.extend_volume to pass Gig suffix
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-16 03:33:03.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': 'Fix lvm.extend_volume to pass Gig suffix

The extend function in the lvm driver was not converting
the cinder size value to Gigabytes before passing the call
to the vg module.  The result was that we would attempt to
extend a volume to "new size in Megabytes" which of course
is less than the current size since we do a Gigabyte string
conversion on create and everywhere else.

This change makes sure we pass the integer change through
the sizestr method to get the G suffix needed to work properly.

Change-Id: I070962a3aa7038f612e19a93ccaa60cbc13008f6
Closes-Bug: #1240287
(cherry picked from commit ec442e41d2d243003a42ed60ae862e96142a5cde)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix lvm.extend_volume to pass Gig suffix

The extend function in the lvm driver was not converting
the cinder size value to Gigabytes before passing the call
to the vg module.  The result was that we would attempt to
extend a volume to "new size in Megabytes" which of course
is less than the current size since we do a Gigabyte string
conversion on create and everywhere else.

This change makes sure we pass the integer change through
the sizestr method to get the G suffix needed to work properly.

Change-Id: I070962a3aa7038f612e19a93ccaa60cbc13008f6
Closes-Bug: #1240287
(cherry picked from commit ec442e41d2d243003a42ed60ae862e96142a5cde)

subject: Fix 500 from account-quota middleware
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 19:36:58.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/account_quotas.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_account_quotas.py'], 'message': 'Fix 500 from account-quota middleware

If a user had set X-Account-Meta-Quota-Bytes to something non-integer
prior to the installation of the account-quota middleware, then the
quota check would choke on it. Now a non-integer value is treated as
"no quota".

Change-Id: I5c38911be1f66fa293aea9c78590d4ce7d184113
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix 500 from account-quota middleware

If a user had set X-Account-Meta-Quota-Bytes to something non-integer
prior to the installation of the account-quota middleware, then the
quota check would choke on it. Now a non-integer value is treated as
"no quota".

commit_message:
Fix Huawei drivers to support other host OSs

Huawei drivers create Linux hosts by default when attaching volumes.
This patch makes them also support Windows, XenServer, AIX, etc.
The default OS is still Linux if it is not specified.

Users need to configure the host OS types in Huawei XML configuration
file. They need to set the items like this:
<Host OSType="Windows" HostIP="10.10.0.1, 10.10.0.2, ..." />
<Host .../>

When attaching a volume, the driver will get the host IP from nova. We
compare that IP with the IP in "HostIP" to get the corresponding OS type.

Closes-bug: #1229759
Change-Id: I36fd52b97f790f1c68eaf24b6c12e7ef5d16145d

commit_message:
Handle VLAN interfaces with Linux IP wrapper

Check if the interface name contains '@' character and use the part
before that character as interface name.

Change-Id: I09eb52f4d41054a76fd140d3a3476c6cfe05226b
Closes-Bug: #1240125

subject: Add warning explaining sf_user_prefix option
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-15 15:24:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add warning explaining sf_user_prefix option

There's an issue with HA environments and the default
config options used for the SolidFire driver.  The SolidFire
driver creates a unique account on the cluster for each tenant,
by default this account name is : <$hostname>-<$tenant-id>

This works great, unless you're in an HA env, in which case there are
two possible accounts that are valid.  Also in the case of upgrading
or migrating your cinder-volume service to a new node, the result is that
the formation of the account name is now for the "new" hostname and users
loose access to their existing volumes that they created on the "old" host.

commit_message:
Add warning explaining sf_user_prefix option

There's an issue with HA environments and the default
config options used for the SolidFire driver.  The SolidFire
driver creates a unique account on the cluster for each tenant,
by default this account name is : <$hostname>-<$tenant-id>

This works great, unless you're in an HA env, in which case there are
two possible accounts that are valid.  Also in the case of upgrading
or migrating your cinder-volume service to a new node, the result is that
the formation of the account name is now for the "new" hostname and users
loose access to their existing volumes that they created on the "old" host.

Change-Id: Id2ffc268e59810decc85f8da4ec41e4b751d65ff

subject: Fix lvm.extend_volume to pass Gig suffix
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-16 01:16:35.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/lvm.py'], 'message': 'Fix lvm.extend_volume to pass Gig suffix

The extend function in the lvm driver was not converting
the cinder size value to Gigabytes before passing the call
to the vg module.  The result was that we would attempt to
extend a volume to "new size in Megabytes" which of course
is less than the current size since we do a Gigabyte string
conversion on create and everywhere else.

This change makes sure we pass the integer change through
the sizestr method to get the G suffix needed to work properly.

Change-Id: I070962a3aa7038f612e19a93ccaa60cbc13008f6
Closes-Bug: #1240287
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix lvm.extend_volume to pass Gig suffix

The extend function in the lvm driver was not converting
the cinder size value to Gigabytes before passing the call
to the vg module.  The result was that we would attempt to
extend a volume to "new size in Megabytes" which of course
is less than the current size since we do a Gigabyte string
conversion on create and everywhere else.

This change makes sure we pass the integer change through
the sizestr method to get the G suffix needed to work properly.

Change-Id: I070962a3aa7038f612e19a93ccaa60cbc13008f6
Closes-Bug: #1240287

commit_message:
Fix DB API mismatch with sqlalchemy API

We added a sqlalchemy columns_to_join argument to the
security_group_get_by_name() method, but didn't punch it through
the toplevel DB API. This patch adds that so that they match.

Change-Id: I6fe8d876834036e6fbd79d60f3d7d696d7cf4b83

commit_message:
Initialize shares variables for RemoteFsDriver(s)

self.shares and self._mounted_shares are used by various methods
for RemoteFs-based drivers, but may not be instantiated early enough.

Initialize them in __init__ to ensure they always exist.  (Also fixes
pylint warnings.)

Closes-Bug: #1239741
Change-Id: I0ef884c28b82b7f694cf8a0fb4629c835da11c91

subject: Fix scheduler rpcapi deprecated method comment
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-14 20:25:41.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Bump scheduler manager rpcapi version

It's at 2.9 and was not bumped when a comment for 2.10 was added to
rpcapi.  It's not really a bug since the comment is only to mark a
removed method, but I think it's better to bump the manager version to

commit_message:
Fix scheduler rpcapi deprecated method comment

A comment was added for 2.10 about deprecating a method.  It's not
necessary to bump the version... and the manager side wasn't bumped.
It's still at 2.9.

Just remove the reference to the 2.10 version.

Change-Id: I52857f5a2e472dbdf13b9b6a51a9e8f401ea6452

commit_message:
Send notifications on keypair create/delete

A service external to Nova may wany to know when users add or delete
keypairs.  This patch adds create and delete notifications to the
KeypairAPI.

Implements blueprint keypair-notifications

Change-Id: I8e0d74e73b1980689c11d9e3567b9883018951cc

commit_message:
Sanitize passwords when logging payload in wsgi

adminPass (or admin_pass) can be either part of a json object or
an xml element or xml attribute. The patch includes
regexps to support all these cases and adds tests
as well

Change-Id: Ic119f986a03863c1d13b566b4c005f3bc77d83d0
Closes-Bug: 1231263

commit_message:
Handle MarkerNotFound better in Flavor API

When the specified marker is not found, we should catch the
MarkerNotFound exception and respond with a HTTP 400 Bad
Request with sufficient information back to the user. This
will avoid spilling unwanted tracebacks in the logs as well.

Change-Id: I90a658384f8814096271a193a0f3abd028062b5d
Partial-Bug: 1238519

commit_message:
Fixes datastore selection bug

Currently the vmwareapi drivers will only select the first
available datastore it finds, even when there are other
datastores with capacity, it will fill one datastore completely
and then die.

Closes-bug: 1227825

Change-Id: I24f85114ea3f014950c27c0c91a6be352990d263

Fix i18n issue for nova/virt/baremetal/virtual_power_driver.py

There are some log messages in virtual_power_driver.py does not
support i18n, we need to update code to support it.

Closes-bug: #1228449

subject: FK lookup failures during migration
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-15 23:06:11.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/018_add_qos_specs.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/017_add_encryption_information.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/020_add_volume_admin_metadata_table.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/015_drop_migrations_table.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/016_drop_sm_tables.py', 'cinder/db/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/010_add_transfers_table.py'], 'message': 'FK lookup failures during migration

There are a couple of cases where migrations have failed
upgrading from Grizzly to Havana, this seems to be isolated
to a couple of migrations so far and the error message is a
failure to lookup/associate the volume-id FK dependency.

It appears that this is caused by not setting the charset
in the migration, so the result is that the initial db setup
uses utf8 and the migrations are using the default latin1.

This patch goes through all of the migrations in Havana that
specify InnoDB and explicitly sets the charset to utf8 to match
the volumes table (and the other original tables).

Change-Id: I43b219ff5e4eea10a7391ad65ef68a80b7460370
Closes-Bug: #1233861
(cherry picked from commit 645a84f990c90e28548cf35b4b5f242eb0e0c286)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
FK lookup failures during migration

There are a couple of cases where migrations have failed
upgrading from Grizzly to Havana, this seems to be isolated
to a couple of migrations so far and the error message is a
failure to lookup/associate the volume-id FK dependency.

It appears that this is caused by not setting the charset
in the migration, so the result is that the initial db setup
uses utf8 and the migrations are using the default latin1.

This patch goes through all of the migrations in Havana that
specify InnoDB and explicitly sets the charset to utf8 to match
the volumes table (and the other original tables).

Change-Id: I43b219ff5e4eea10a7391ad65ef68a80b7460370
Closes-Bug: #1233861
(cherry picked from commit 645a84f990c90e28548cf35b4b5f242eb0e0c286)

commit_message:
Removing rpc communication from db transaction

In a transaction context of ExtraRoute_db_mixin.update_router() was
called super method that uses subtransaction and communication with l3
agent. In case of agent's heartbeat happens while there is running
transaction, update heartbeat in agents table gets stuck in a deadlock.

Closes-Bug: #1211915
Change-Id: I96e6a9d7172d5a0e3e720a81fcd10f04c40aef07

commit_message:
Fix conductor rpcapi deprecated method comment

A comment was added for 1.59 about deprecating a method.  It's not
necessary to bump the version... and the manager side wasn't bumped.
It's still at 1.58.

Just remove the reference to the version.

Change-Id: I3b3eca72acc28f0c29f8dff8402937eab7152a37

Requires I208ac2c316cf76fe928062d8a1c98a02aa1dff1c to be effective but
can be merged before it lands.

commit_message:
Make pypi-mirror more secure and robust

There's no reason we need to run this mirror as root, so run it as a
system user. Also it is creating a cache of removable data, which really
belongs in /var/cache, so we put the data there instead of /opt/stack.

Change-Id: I47d436733e9dd6ca0bebc25bf577e6d749d36f35

commit_message:
Make XenAPI use Aggregate object

This makes the XenAPI driver use the Aggregate object for its work,
and avoids the need to call back through virtapi to conductor
directly. It also allows us to convert the two aggregate-related
compute manager methods fully to new-world objects.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects
Related to blueprint virt-objects

Closes-bug: #1232179
Change-Id: Ib38ab0e4d6feefebda37888f150752167474b693

commit_message:
Split out unit tests as separate tox jobs

This commit removes the tempest unit tests from the same tox job as
the tempest runs. It creates a separate py26, py27, and py33 tox job
for running the unit tests.

Change-Id: I9efea4cfa42f770c34869c0b0931b0ed0b51c177

commit_message:
Consolidates TestCase and BaseTestCase

Most unit tests are derived from TestCase class of base.py.
A few unit tests are derived from BaseTestCase class of utils.py.
This patch consolidates these two classes into one and have all
the tests derived from a single base class which is TestCase class.
Hence, the ironic/tests/util.py is removed from this patch.

Change-Id: Iecc3352ef7e49524b202e6551a233692a2f6acea

commit_message:
Fix seed network setup.

I missed a setup-neutron call when adding bare metal metadata routes.
Also changed the order of parameters to neutron so SUBNET_EXTRA is last
and parsed correctly.

Co-Authored-By: Roman Podolyaka <rpodolyaka@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ic41cdd60a9cd4c94fb4d4cff7346a37ae4a85a65

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-15 20:01:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'FK lookup failures during migration

There are a couple of cases where migrations have failed
upgrading from Grizlly to Havana, this seems to be isolated
to a couple of migrations so far and the error message is a
failure to lookup/associate the volume-id FK dependency.

It appears that this is caused by not setting the charset
in the migration, so the result is that the initial db setup
uses utf8 and the migrations are using the default latin1.

This patch goes through all of the migrations in Havana that

commit_message:
FK lookup failures during migration

There are a couple of cases where migrations have failed
upgrading from Grizzly to Havana, this seems to be isolated
to a couple of migrations so far and the error message is a
failure to lookup/associate the volume-id FK dependency.

It appears that this is caused by not setting the charset
in the migration, so the result is that the initial db setup
uses utf8 and the migrations are using the default latin1.

This patch goes through all of the migrations in Havana that
specify InnoDB and explicitly sets the charset to utf8 to match
the volumes table (and the other original tables).

Change-Id: I43b219ff5e4eea10a7391ad65ef68a80b7460370
Closes-Bug: #1233861

commit_message:
Update short description language

There is a legal/english thing that needs to happen here - it can't be
"OpenStack Benchmark System" due to trademark issues unless it's
blessed. It can be "Benchmark System for OpenStack" - which I think
should be about the same.

subject: Allow v2 client authentication with trust_id
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-26 14:37:15.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/v2_0/client.py', 'keystoneclient/access.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/v2_0/test_auth.py', 'keystoneclient/tests/utils.py'], 'message': "Allow v2 client authentication with trust_id

It should be possible to authenticate against the v2 tokens
API with a trust_id, because it suports rescoping an existing
token to a trust, this patch adds client support for this.

Note with the current keystone code it's necessary to pass the
trustor tenant ID when rescoping with a trust where
impersonation==True, e.g:

c = client_v2.Client(username=TRUSTEE_USERNAME,
                     password=TRUSTEE_USERNAME,
                     tenant_name=TRUSTEE_TENANT_NAME,
                     auth_url=OS_AUTH_URL_V2)
c.authenticate(trust_id=trust_i.id, tenant_id=TRUSTOR_TENANT_ID)

Change-Id: I177c41af298b7437e2c6fb437aa9ce9a09773b9d
Closes-Bug: #1231483
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Allow v2 client authentication with trust_id

It should be possible to authenticate against the v2 tokens
API with a trust_id, because it suports rescoping an existing
token to a trust, this patch adds client support for this.

Note with the current keystone code it's necessary to pass the
trustor tenant ID when rescoping with a trust where
impersonation==True, e.g:

c = client_v2.Client(username=TRUSTEE_USERNAME,
                     password=TRUSTEE_USERNAME,
                     tenant_name=TRUSTEE_TENANT_NAME,
                     auth_url=OS_AUTH_URL_V2)
c.authenticate(trust_id=trust_i.id, tenant_id=TRUSTOR_TENANT_ID)

Change-Id: I177c41af298b7437e2c6fb437aa9ce9a09773b9d
Closes-Bug: #1231483

commit_message:
Fix v2 token user ref with trust impersonation=True

The v2 token controller incorrectly checks for a string instead
of a boolean, which results in the wrong user ID (trustee, when
it should be the trustor) when impersonation=True.  So fix the
comparison and tests, adding a test which illustrates the issue.

Change-Id: Ic94f30f2354c9fda20531bb598387368fde8a096
Closes-Bug: #1239303

commit_message:
Rename tests to _tests

PEP8 says that internal modules should be prefixed with _. Since
tests is not a public module it should be prefixed with _.

See http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0008/#public-and-internal-interfaces

Change-Id: If1609bc5432986be1bf7ebee20f8a5e259eeac8e

commit_message:
populate local-ipv4 address in config drive

Currently the ec2 metadata in config drive does not include the
local-ipv4 address, because the address is not passed in when using
config drive.

This change uses the fixed_ips in network_info to populate the address
if the address was not passed in.

Fixes bug 1221664
Change-Id: I1b289bbbd7ebe103342909079d2488cf1dfbf472

subject: Make os-cache retry on an invalid token
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-10 08:33:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Make os-cache retry on an invalid token

client.authenticate doesn't actually do any rest calls if a token is present,
it just assumes the token is valid.  Instead re-authentication is done if the
request raises an Unauthorized exception, at which point we want to
unauthenticate (delete the token from in-memory) and overwrite the old token
in the keyring. Also if a password is present allways pass it into the client
so re-authentication is possible during _cs_request.

Change-Id: I86d0356d5685ffa802f1bdc97e33727ff2dd075e
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-10 17:17:15.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/client.py', 'novaclient/shell.py'], 'message': "Make os-cache retry on an invalid token

client.authenticate doesn't actually do any rest calls if a token is present,
it just assumes the token is valid.  Instead re-authentication is done if the
request raises an Unauthorized exception, at which point we want to
unauthenticate (delete the token from in-memory) and overwrite the old token
in the keyring. Also if a password is present allways pass it into the client
so re-authentication is possible during _cs_request.

Change-Id: I86d0356d5685ffa802f1bdc97e33727ff2dd075e
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Make os-cache retry on an invalid token

client.authenticate doesn't actually do any rest calls if a token is present,
it just assumes the token is valid.  Instead re-authentication is done if the
request raises an Unauthorized exception, at which point we want to
unauthenticate (delete the token from in-memory) and overwrite the old token
in the keyring. Also if a password is present allways pass it into the client
so re-authentication is possible during _cs_request.

Change-Id: I86d0356d5685ffa802f1bdc97e33727ff2dd075e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-10 08:33:00.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/shell.py'], 'message': "Document and make OS_CACHE work

Before the --os-no-cache option logic would overwrite any value set in env['OS_CACHE'].
Since os-no-cache  is deprecated, and also the default value, just remove it.
Also update the help message for --os-cache to mention the environment variable.

commit_message:
Document and make OS_CACHE work

Before the --os-no-cache option logic would overwrite any value set in env['OS_CACHE'].
Since os-no-cache  is deprecated, and also the default value, just remove it.
Also update the help message for --os-cache to mention the environment variable.

Change-Id: Ie2569d5cdf0f12f3a29e9a6f20faef75956d2209

subject: When translating if no locale is given use default locale
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5371, 'name': 'Mathew Odden', 'email': 'locke105@gmail.com', 'username': 'locke105'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 7996, 'name': 'Luis A. Garcia', 'email': 'luis@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'luisg'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-03 20:18:54.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "When translating if no locale is given use default locale

In get_localized_message we were only updating a Message's locale if it
was not None, but None is also a valid request, it means the default.
If a Message had been previously translated and since None was ignored,
the message was translated to the last translated locale. This patch
fixes that.

Change-Id: I8e1a594d779d18c88dc42c612900442d191bfa70
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-09 19:35:20.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_gettext.py', 'openstack/common/gettextutils.py'], 'message': "When translating if no locale is given use default locale

In get_localized_message we were only updating a Message's locale if it
was not None, but None is also a valid request, it means the default.
If a Message had been previously translated and since None was ignored,
the message was translated to the last translated locale. This patch
fixes that. It also makes sure that the given message object's locale is
not changed after translation.

Change-Id: I8e1a594d779d18c88dc42c612900442d191bfa70
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
When translating if no locale is given use default locale

In get_localized_message we were only updating a Message's locale if it
was not None, but None is also a valid request, it means the default.
If a Message had been previously translated and since None was ignored,
the message was translated to the last translated locale. This patch
fixes that. It also makes sure that the given message object's locale is
not changed after translation.

Change-Id: I8e1a594d779d18c88dc42c612900442d191bfa70

commit_message:
Revert "Add-in some re-auth logic when using os_cache"

This patch didn't do what it was supposed to do, make os_cache work. Instead it just adds complexity, so just remove it.

This reverts commit 8eed73ce20ff0808d350fc9af66d6ba55ebda017.

Change-Id: I7c118cbf8d8e2218e198d603f1984a9de18266c4

subject: Don't override default value for eventlet.wsgi.server logging
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-15 01:54:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Set eventlet.wsgi.server log to INFO from WARN

We want eventlet.wsgi.server to log in the INFO level so it will log all
requests.

default log_format:
'%(client_ip)s - - [%(date_time)s] "%(request_line)s"
%(status_code)s %(body_length)s %(wall_seconds).6f'

Change-Id: I42124793bbf542d69f6493bb3a9611e443775c2a
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-15 19:12:04.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/log.py'], 'message': "Don't override default value for eventlet.wsgi.server logging

We want eventlet.wsgi.server to use the same log level as everything
else (by default). For example if INFO logging is enabled eventlet.wsgi.server will
log all API requests. So if INFO logging is enabled in the API server we
want eventlet.wsgi.server to use the same log level.

This only changes a default value, and can be set by the user.

Change-Id: I42124793bbf542d69f6493bb3a9611e443775c2a
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Don't override default value for eventlet.wsgi.server logging

We want eventlet.wsgi.server to use the same log level as everything
else (by default). For example if INFO logging is enabled eventlet.wsgi.server will
log all API requests. So if INFO logging is enabled in the API server we
want eventlet.wsgi.server to use the same log level.

This only changes a default value, and can be set by the user.

Change-Id: I42124793bbf542d69f6493bb3a9611e443775c2a

commit_message:
Use `versionutils.is_compatible` for Nova Objects

Oslo's check is designed to support version checking for a number of different
existing use-cases, including this one.

Related-Oslo-Commit: d7d74a752e34d5249fa47c8e8252da491d46012a

commit_message:
Also allow "_" to be valid identifier

A "_" is a valid python identifier as long as it
is not the first letter of the given attribute (as
an attribute dict doesn't have the concept of
protected/private variables).

Also include a few links and comments as to why
the restrictions are inplace.

Change-Id: I23f17113cedb99b2817bad0c464a43d10af6722c

commit_message:
Add parsing into config.py to see if ceph deployed

For now tests skipeed if there is no cinder node.
But it is not correct when ceph deployed as a volume storage
Add parsing of nailgun response if the cheph deployed
Add verification in test

Fix bug PRD-2087

Change-Id: I921bff6f15c1891012e802c1569b3ae0ec17d08a

Walls', 'email': 'jeff.walls@hpe.com', 'username': 'ftcjeff'}, {'_account_id': 8810, 'name': 'Francisco Demonti dos Santos Junior', 'email': 'demontie@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'demontiejr'}, {'_account_id': 8866, 'name': 'Raildo Mascena de Sousa Filho', 'email': 'rmascena@redhat.com', 'username': 'raildo'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 19:48:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'horizon is removing the URL path from glance's endpoint

Autor: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Glanceclient removes the API version from the endpoint in case it exists. Look the following code:

https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/master/glanceclient/shell.py#L310

    def _strip_version(self, endpoint):
        """Strip version from the last component of endpoint if present."""

        # Get rid of trailing '/' if present
        if endpoint.endswith('/'):
            endpoint = endpoint[:-1]
        url_bits = endpoint.split('/')
        # regex to match 'v1' or 'v2.0' etc
        if re.match('v\d+\.?\d*', url_bits[-1]):
            endpoint = '/'.join(url_bits[:-1])
        return endpoint

The rest of code includes the API version in use accordingly.

Change-Id: I7a393fbb6ed82aad3756c2a231cc693a0e86e217

commit_message:
Bug: horizon is removing the URL path from glance's endpoint
https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1188182

Autor: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Glanceclient removes the API version from the endpoint in case it exists. Look the following code:

https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/master/glanceclient/shell.py#L310

The rest of code includes the API version in use accordingly.

Change-Id: I7a393fbb6ed82aad3756c2a231cc693a0e86e217

no longer need to carry it.

commit_message:
Fix root disk not be detached after deleting lxc container

Add teardown_container action when cleanup lxc instance to make
sure root disk be detached and no resource leak.

Fixes: bug #1208387
       bug #1203927

Change-Id: I063fd3a9856bba089bcde5cdefd2576e2eb2b0e9

[{'created': '2013-10-01 21:49:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Fixes Hyper-V issue with VHD file format

The VHD format cookie signature needs to be checked in the footer
instead of the header as fixed format VHDs don't have a copy of the
footer at the beginning of the file.

VHD format specs:

http://download.microsoft.com/download/f/f/e/ffef50a5-07dd-4cf8-aaa3-442c0673a029/Virtual%20Hard%20Disk%20Format%20Spec_10_18_06.doc

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V issue with VHD file format

The VHD format cookie signature needs to be checked in the footer
instead of the header as fixed format VHDs don't have a copy of the
footer at the beginning of the file.

Fixes bug: #1233853

Change-Id: Ibe44f0d895cde2edbc03dcd6ecebac24b0936660

commit_message:
Fixing restart tests

* Remove rax specific tests
* Fix delete test grouping
* Fix the mess up mysql logic
* Fix ovz command if CONF.use_local_ovz
* Fix logic in Checker that was masking errors in tests

Fixes: Bug #1204233

Change-Id: I6ac8abb47d4cff0ae20432f059686e4f1dd55a7e

for the password parameter, and missing the keystone ssh parameter.

commit_message:
Use driver_prefix in NfsDriver

Use driver_prefix in NfsDriver methods to give a chance for others
volume drivers, that inherit NfsDriver use their custom options.

Change-Id: Ic4a8d550856c14ae8ef0b08125098bb140a4ec09

commit_message:
The V2 Api should delete a non existent image

Glance V2 api initiates the deletion of an image that
got deleted during upload. This ensures that there
are no orphaned chunks of the image left behind

Fixes bug #1226013

Change-Id: I4cf5c49d2a6d2157a38467d9f7bcb20c4562b642

commit_message:
not install DHCP agent on compute node by default

From the quantum document, when there are 3 types
nodes: controller node, network node, and compute
node, it's always supposed that the network node
has OpenStack Networking L2 agent, DHCP agent and
L3 agent, and the compute node has OpenStack Networking
L2 agent and the OpenStack Compute services. There
is not the DHCP agent on the compute node.But the
current recipes always installs the DHCP agent on
the compute node by default. So remove the dhcp_agent
from the network plugins list, and the network_spec.rb
also is modified.

Closes-Bug: #1233009
Change-Id: I936a55ab055ee16b203df8479f18f3ea46a9870e

commit_message:
Make the request object API aware

The patch makes the Request object aware of the API but not dependent on
it. This gives to the Request object - and to the each transport
implementation - more information about what the current operation is
suppose to do, what params it accepts and what methods it can handle.

For example, a transport could use the API info to build the final URL
based on the ref specified there.

Partially-Implements blueprint python-marconiclient-v1

Change-Id: I4ab1e2815807327706390aad4223c665a0ebeeda

commit_message:
Pass errors from *_format.parse() to the caller

This gives the user a nice helpful error message, something like:

ERROR: Template not in valid format: while parsing a block mapping
  in "<unicode string>", line 2, column 3:
      KeyName:
      ^


Change-Id: I1c0aaa955981eec264e1ff3cc66ad15adc771e72
Closes-bug: #1226106

Change-Id: Ib7bd3c37d8b4cf57d1608f9ab3bb44f3b046e582

commit_message:
Fix cleanup for testsets

Logic that introduces cleaning up actions after manual stop of testset
has been fixed. For smoke testset cleanup_path was added to
__profile__. cleanup function from cleanup.py has been modified so that
it now properly treats situations when different additional components
is not installed. To NoseDriver's method _clean_up was added
functionality that retrieves deployment tags for current cluster and
passes it to cleanup function which in turn perform proper cleaning
actions.

Change-Id: Ib7bd3c37d8b4cf57d1608f9ab3bb44f3b046e582

subject: Wait for heat-admin to be configured on undercloud
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-14 22:50:32.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Wait for heat-admin to be configured on undercloud

cloud-init configures the heat-admin user after ssh comes up, if things
happen fast enough when init-keystone tries to ssh to the undercloud it
may stall while ssh waits for a password to be entered. We need to wait
for the ssh key to be in place

Change-Id: I87edb55a38f2a3e21e1653e57e9849e971ba02c8
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-15 16:03:19.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/devtest_undercloud.sh'], 'message': 'Wait for heat-admin to be configured on undercloud

cloud-init configures the heat-admin user after ssh comes up, if things
happen fast enough when init-keystone tries to ssh to the undercloud it
may stall while ssh waits for a password to be entered. We need to wait
for the ssh key to be in place.

Change-Id: I87edb55a38f2a3e21e1653e57e9849e971ba02c8
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Wait for heat-admin to be configured on undercloud

cloud-init configures the heat-admin user after ssh comes up, if things
happen fast enough when init-keystone tries to ssh to the undercloud it
may stall while ssh waits for a password to be entered. We need to wait
for the ssh key to be in place.

Change-Id: I87edb55a38f2a3e21e1653e57e9849e971ba02c8

commit_message:
Remove deprecated NOVA_RAX_AUTH

NOVA_RAX_AUTH has been deprecated in favor of a generic pluggable auth,
which in this case rackspace users can set OS_AUTH_SYSTEM=rackspace

Fixes bug 966329

Change-Id: Ie55fc36a0ac1cba61efa8bdd2f20809530d3365f

commit_message:
Avoid suppressing underlying error when deploy.loadapp fails

Raise log level at the first load attempt. If there is a
fundamental problem with the environment, a Lookup error
is not helpful in troubleshooting the problem further.

Fix bug 1210236

Change-Id: I55aa11a0e5a37dbef3f0c1b55aa4c9c11bbf55d9

commit_message:
Allow adding arguments to disk-image-create

This will allow us to set things like --offline or add elements like
pypi and others that are specific to our build environment.

commit_message:
Test for error in setUpClass

New test environment (new fixture data in nailgun_mimic.py, new fake
test for produce given error was added to dummy_tests, new test in
functional tests to test errorness behaviour) was added.

Fix bug with updating tests status after unhandled exception in
setUpClass of test case.

Method _add_message of StoragePlugin class from nose_storage_plugin.py
has been modified so that it now updates tests for ContextSuite with
error properly. New util function get_tests_ids_to_update was added to
nose_utils.py. This function performs recursive searching of tests in
ContextSuite object. Such functionality takes is needed in orded to
avoid problems that may occur when uhandled exception is raised in
setUpClass method of TestCase. Functional tests for new behaviour have
been created. Some non-major fixes and refactoring of different chunks
were added.

Change-Id: I5ef9cd7a139425ae38ac54a396301b7d0763b4d2

commit_message:
Skip get_server_diagnostics test until bug 1240043 is fixed

Change If631472081d16fe8c0b37575eb157a7b13d6fba4 introduced new restrictions
on the diagnostics API which are not valid with XenAPI and causes it to fail
tempest tests.

Bug 1240043 has been raised to define a hypervisor-agnostic API which can be
tested and maintained

Closes bug: 1239209

Change-Id: I3e643d8e7a63b7dc42a912fab09ffc4222d463db

commit_message:
Test rediscovering for redeployed cluster fix

In models.py file descriprion of new entity called ClusterState was
added. This new entity stores info about current cluster state (its
deployment tags). Function discovery_check has been modified: logic that
controlls rediscovering of tests for redeployed cluster has been
changed. It now is based on data from ClusterState. Unit tests have been
fixed in orded to support new logic. New initial alembic migration has
been created (cluster_state entity is included).

Rediscovering logic has been fixed.

Change-Id: I61bf4d56a097a49413c494adee5587cfad83949c

commit_message:
Make aggregate methods use new-world objects

This makes the add_aggregate_host() and remove_aggregate_host()
methods on compute manager use new-world objects. It introduces
a new compatibility decorator since object_compat() is specifically
tailored to instance methods, which makes sharing it really
complex and ugly.

Note that we still convert the aggregates back to primitive form
before passing to the drivers, which will be removed once we teach
the drivers to use/take aggregate objects directly (coming next).

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

subject: don't doubly escape html files
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-15 00:29:06.000000000', 'files': ['os_loganalyze/wsgi.py', 'os_loganalyze/tests/test_filters.py'], 'message': "don't doubly escape html files

we want to process console.html files for timestamp links, however
these files are already escaped by jenkins to be valid html, so
our previous assumption that we should always escape lines is
invalid.

based on the filename, don't doubly escape the lines in the file.
Added unit tests to ensure we had expected console.html output
after running it through the filter.

Change-Id: I3a0e6bca782b134bed9f385be056befd3a2f30c7
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
don't doubly escape html files

we want to process console.html files for timestamp links, however
these files are already escaped by jenkins to be valid html, so
our previous assumption that we should always escape lines is
invalid.

based on the filename, don't doubly escape the lines in the file.
Added unit tests to ensure we had expected console.html output
after running it through the filter.

Change-Id: I3a0e6bca782b134bed9f385be056befd3a2f30c7

subject: Add third element to RPC versions for backports
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-10 16:09:16.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_utils.py', 'oslo/messaging/_utils.py'], 'message': 'Add third element to RPC versions for backports

This makes the RPC version support three elements, adding a "revision"
in addition to the major and minor version. The revision would always
be zero for the master branch of a service, but could be incremented
for stable versions. This provides us some room to backport fixes
that affect RPC versions in such a way that would avoid breaking
the version lineage for systems running stable versions that may
some day be involved in a rolling upgrade to a version from master.

I didn't find any tests for version_is_compatible(), so I added
some for existing version scenarios, as well as new ones with
revisions. They also serve to validate that this doesn't break
anything for code using two-element versions (the expectation is that
two-element versions will still be used everywhere until a third
is needed).

Porting chages from Change-Id I239c17a3e305f572493498c4b96ee3c7514c5881
to oslo-incubator

Change-Id: I4fa7b0be14a7afba36136a746b76036355f119b2
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-10-10 16:09:16.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add third element to RPC versions for backports

This makes the RPC version support three elements, adding a "revision"
in addition to the major and minor version. The revision would always
be zero for the master branch of a service, but could be incremented
for stable versions. This provides us some room to backport fixes
that affect RPC versions in such a way that would avoid breaking
the version lineage for systems running stable versions that may
some day be involved in a rolling upgrade to a version from master.

I didn't find any tests for version_is_compatible(), so I added

anything for code using two-element versions (the expectation is that

to oslo-incubator

Change-Id: I4fa7b0be14a7afba36136a746b76036355f119b2
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add third element to RPC versions for backports

This makes the RPC version support three elements, adding a "revision"
in addition to the major and minor version. The revision would always
be zero for the master branch of a service, but could be incremented
for stable versions. This provides us some room to backport fixes
that affect RPC versions in such a way that would avoid breaking
the version lineage for systems running stable versions that may
some day be involved in a rolling upgrade to a version from master.

I didn't find any tests for version_is_compatible(), so I added
some for existing version scenarios, as well as new ones with
revisions. They also serve to validate that this doesn't break
anything for code using two-element versions (the expectation is that
two-element versions will still be used everywhere until a third
is needed).

Porting chages from Change-Id I239c17a3e305f572493498c4b96ee3c7514c5881
to oslo-incubator

Change-Id: I4fa7b0be14a7afba36136a746b76036355f119b2

subject: Handle the case no SimpleTenantUsage Nova extension
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-30 14:11:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Handle the case no SimpleTenantUsage Nova extension

When the SimpleTenantUsage Nova extension is not enabled,
panels that include usages produce an error and
the usage table is useless.

Three panels use the SimpleTenantUsage extension:
- openstack_dashboard.dashboards.admin.overview
- openstack_dashboard.dashboards.admin.projects
- openstack_dashboard.dashboards.project.overview

This fix avoids errors and does not show the usage
table in such a case.

A context variable 'simple_tenant_usage_enabled' is now
available in templates rendered by usage.UsageView subclasses.

commit_message:
Handle the case no SimpleTenantUsage Nova extension

When the SimpleTenantUsage Nova extension is not enabled,
panels that include usages produce an error and
the usage table is useless.

Three panels use the SimpleTenantUsage extension:
- openstack_dashboard.dashboards.admin.overview
- openstack_dashboard.dashboards.admin.projects
- openstack_dashboard.dashboards.project.overview

This fix avoids errors and does not show the usage
table in such a case.

A context variable 'simple_tenant_usage_enabled' is now
available in templates rendered by usage.UsageView subclasses.

Unit tests now mock nova 'extension_supported' API.

Change-Id: Ib306846bf6c947572ba0e7c773125d03b3dbf68b
Closes-Bug: #1211470

subject: align the order of parameters for urlencode()
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-15 06:26:55.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometerclient/tests/v2/test_samples.py', 'ceilometerclient/tests/v2/test_options.py', 'ceilometerclient/tests/v2/test_resources.py', 'ceilometerclient/common/utils.py', 'ceilometerclient/v2/options.py', 'ceilometerclient/tests/v2/test_statistics.py', 'ceilometerclient/tests/v2/test_alarms.py'], 'message': 'align the order of parameters for urlencode()

In Python 3.3, hash randomization is enabled by default. It causes the
iteration order of dicts and sets to be unpredictable and differ
across Python runs.

In the test case, the fixed expecting string will not match the test
result, it is relying on the dict order.

This change transforms the input dict to a sequence of two-element list,
with fixed order, and update the related expecitng string / fixture
in test cases.

Partial Implement: blueprint py33-support

Change-Id: I6dccde9e584be8335a6375f5fbad5c5cbd7b9b6d
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
align the order of parameters for urlencode()

In Python 3.3, hash randomization is enabled by default. It causes the
iteration order of dicts and sets to be unpredictable and differ
across Python runs.

In the test case, the fixed expecting string will not match the test
result, it is relying on the dict order.

This change transforms the input dict to a sequence of two-element list,
with fixed order, and update the related expecitng string / fixture
in test cases.

Partial Implement: blueprint py33-support

Change-Id: I6dccde9e584be8335a6375f5fbad5c5cbd7b9b6d

commit_message:
Add the option to minimize ovs l2 polling

This change adds the ability to monitor the local ovsdb for
interface changes so that the l2 agent can avoid unnecessary
polling.  Minimal changes are made to the agent so the risk
of breakage should be low.  Future efforts to make the agent
entirely event-based may be able to use OvsdbMonitor as a
starting point.

By default polling minimization is not done, and can only be
enabled by setting 'minimize_polling = True' in the ovs
section of the l2 agent's config file.

Closes-Bug: #1177973

Change-Id: I26c035b48a74df2148696869c5a9affae5ab3d27

commit_message:
Improve ovs_lib bridge management

Add the ability to add and remove bridges, check for bridge
existence, and lookup the bridge associated with a port.

This change is in support of functional testing for an ovsdb
monitor.

Partial-Bug: #1177973

Change-Id: I419923d8d77983997cd347fcf063b0bc367c0bbc

There are some projects that mix assertNotEqual and assertNotEquals
it their testscripts. According to Python 3 source code, assertNotEquals
is also deprecated.

Lib/unittest/case.py:

commit_message:
Add assertNotEquals check to H602

There are some projects that mix assertNotEqual and assertNotEquals
in their testscripts. According to Python 3 source code, assertNotEquals
is also deprecated. This patch adds a check for assertNotEquals in H602 since
it already handles assertEquals and has not been released yet.

Lib/unittest/case.py:
    failIfEqual = assertNotEquals = _deprecate(assertNotEqual)

Change-Id: I087bd4b23cb2daa59a1df32926ddcc5cc2052f5c

commit_message:
Reduce vm creations in negative tests

In test_server_actions.py, there is a feature that the same server is
used with all test cases. The feature have reduced vm creations.
This patch adds the same feature to negative tests.

Change-Id: I286082e3a8d35bc57049741bedb8026021b653bd

commit_message:
Adds common image utils

This is the first step to merge the code in nova/virt/images.py
and cinder/image/image_utils.py.

This patch pulls up the QemuImgInfo class which is common
in the two modules above.
The test script is based on nova/tests/virt/test_images.py with
an additional test_qemu_info_blank testcase.

Partially implements bp imageutils

Change-Id: Ia07739492776180e579b03920aa32b9215ce941d

commit_message:
Net probe fails with timeout on check_dhcp request with a lot of iface and vlans

Change-Id: I49610410eb414bea43e3cb3dc62b043bee9d5427
Solution: Provide interface to limit time waiting for response and times request is repeated

commit_message:
Refactoring of log preparation initial ubuntu progress bar
* small refactoring
* add support log progress for multiple OSes
* create separate file for exceptions
* fix indentations
* remove pending test

Tested by hand for centos/ubuntu in simple mode.
More tests will be in next patches.

Change-Id: Id3e0131819c33a96409578f05b3808765d6c0d08

commit_message:
Add log_handler to implement the publish_errors config option

This handler sends all error logs as rpc notifications.
Note: when using publish_errors you also need to set the
notification_driver option too.

Change-Id: I9ceb1fa92118161779b4b29e2cdc3b91f79ab733
Closes-bug: #1229246

commit_message:
Replace unicode() with six.u()

six.u(text)
A fake unicode literal. text should always be a normal string literal.
In Python 2, u() returns unicode, and in Python 3, a string.

Partial Implement: blueprint py33-support

Change-Id: I02849e540c1fbb1f8b02bcbfa4d9be4f60279926

commit_message:
Import six.StringIO

six.StringIO
This is an fake file object for textual data. It is an alias for
StringIO.StringIO in Python 2 and io.StringIO in Python 3.

Partial Implement: blueprint py33-support

Change-Id: I76c05041565614241eea7b7595e4503c88211ee8

subject: Change netaddress types to raw
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-14 22:54:03.000000000', 'files': ['elements/neutron-openvswitch-agent/neutron-ovs-agent-bin/init-neutron-ovs'], 'message': "Change netaddress types to raw

If the value is left as a blank string (the default in a devtest run

Change-Id: Id8a48f1171f484d9e52ebed481d1fa6dd47f8777
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Change netaddress types to raw

If the value is left as a blank string (the default in a devtest run
on overcloud), the call to os-config-applier errors as '' doesn't
match the netaddress type. This in turn causes os-collect-config to
fail.

Change-Id: Id8a48f1171f484d9e52ebed481d1fa6dd47f8777

subject: Don't publish samples if resource_id in missing
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-14 14:55:41.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/objectstore/swift_middleware.py', 'tests/objectstore/test_swift_middleware.py'], 'message': 'Don't publish samples if resource_id in missing

In swift API, the user can call uri without the resource_id.
This patch skip the samples publishing instead of raising the
exception:

Traceback (most recent call last):
File "ceilometer/objectstore/swift_middleware.py", line 109, in iter_response
    bytes_sent)
File "ceilometer/objectstore/swift_middleware.py", line 160, in publish_sample
    resource_id=account.partition('AUTH_')[2],
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'partition'

It print the exception of the samples publishing failure instead of
raising a exception to never break the swift API.

Fixes bug #1223259

Change-Id: I5d90fa620c8f8ea82e86524b9703049257ca0345
(cherry picked from commit e52e5070b3e0fb8c71e806eda036631e25628800)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Don't publish samples if resource_id in missing

In swift API, the user can call uri without the resource_id.
This patch skip the samples publishing instead of raising the
exception:

Traceback (most recent call last):
File "ceilometer/objectstore/swift_middleware.py", line 109, in iter_response
    bytes_sent)
File "ceilometer/objectstore/swift_middleware.py", line 160, in publish_sample
    resource_id=account.partition('AUTH_')[2],
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'partition'

It print the exception of the samples publishing failure instead of
raising a exception to never break the swift API.

Fixes bug #1223259

Change-Id: I5d90fa620c8f8ea82e86524b9703049257ca0345
(cherry picked from commit e52e5070b3e0fb8c71e806eda036631e25628800)

commit_message:
Fix get_resources timestamp ordering for SQLAlchemy

This patch ports over the ResourceTestOrdering tests from
Ceilometer Master (Havana-3 RC-1) and applies them to the
SQLAlchemy driver for stable/grizzly along with a fix.
Partial cherry-pick from
change ID Ib09e21cbc7bbd45a6ecc321403e9947df837e14b.

commit_message:
Make LaunchConfiguration resources mergeable

This can be very useful for merging of Metadata to be used
by optional services (e. g. to add services like tuskar to
undercloud on demand).

commit_message:
Move is_volume_backed_instance to new style BDM

Compute API is_volume_backed_instance used to rely on matching the
device name to the root_device_name field of the instance which had
several problems and edge cases.

Now that we have moved to the new BDM format that has the boot_index
and destination_type field for each block device - it is pretty
staightforward to implement.

Change-Id: Ia2c235f8bce577ed4ac6a480a4a051d159a5fad7
blueprint: clean-up-legacy-block-device-mapping

commit_message:
Add a get_root_bdm utility function

Getting the root block device out of a list of block devices is a common
idiom and we use it in several places in our code base. This patch
factors it out in a handy utilty method and adds tests for it.

Change-Id: I4a2cb3c689fed9fbc0bc51ddba095e1269cacb2d
blueprint: clean-up-legacy-block-device-mapping

subject: Support Nova functions if using NoopFirewallDriver in Neutron
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-30 02:39:30.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Support Nova functions if using NoopFirewallDriver in Neutron

The command nova list is not working if setting NoopFirewallDriver
as firewall in Neutron, since the extension of security groups won't
be loaded by Neutron, which leads an exception raised by neutronclient.

    * Catch the neutronclient exception in function list_security_groups()

", 'number': 3}, {'created': '2013-09-30 15:43:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Support Nova functions if using NoopFirewallDriver in Neutron

The command nova list is not working if setting NoopFirewallDriver
as firewall in Neutron, since the extension of security groups won't

commit_message:
Support Nova functions if using NoopFirewallDriver in Neutron

The command nova list is not working if setting NoopFirewallDriver
as firewall in Neutron, since the extension of security groups won't
be loaded by Neutron, which leads an exception raised by neutronclient.

    * Catch the neutronclient exception in function list_security_groups()
    * Add unit test

Closes-Bug #1232965

Change-Id: I2ebb77734345930a53f00a3873c43f013c94af9b

commit_message:
Remove obsolete redhat-eventlet.patch

See I62ce43a330d7ae94eda4c7498782a655e63747fa for the gorey details on
why this exists.

As of this fix:

  https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/pull/34

which was released in eventlet 0.13, we no longer need the patch.

This has now been removed from oslo-incubator, so this is really just
syncing that removal.

Change-Id: I84267f3c6726cb2e750f615e107c48b12c6ed353

commit_message:
Enhance VMware instance disk usage

Add instance image cache mechanism, when use_linked_clone is enabled,
images downloaded from Glance will be extend to the specified flavor
size and store in image base directory as cache. The instance root disk
will use the cached image files as link clone. If use_linked_clone is
disabled, we will copy the full image from cache to instance directory.

This patch also adds support for ephemeral disk.

Implement blueprint improve-vmware-disk-usage

Change-Id: I62e2967e1ef2e85ec653d75d3b3a90aeb9331412

commit_message:
Updating address pairs with xml doesn't work

Below command can't work because list element
"allowed_address_pairs" hasn't been updated
into the varaiable "attr.PLURALS"
"neutron port-update <port-uuid> \
--allowed-address-pairs list=true type=dict \
ip_address=10.0.0.1 --request-format xml"

Change-Id: I0d7dcca5f4848bc968f5c86fbeb46569c70c8fcd
Closes-Bug: #1229954

commit_message:
Fix to properly log when we release a semaphore

add a try/finally to ensure the LOG.debug is printed
properly. Currently the debug message is never executed

Related-Bug: 1235437

for python 3 compatibility.

commit_message:
Fix Hive config properties for EDP

 * pass username and password to config
 otherwise EDP is not working (hive requires
 these properties applied to running metastore)

Change-Id: I0a95a1b4d40d7c27b0aeebb41f3ba96ffdd6479d

commit_message:
Add service as filter when get hosts

Service parameter is in the documentation as a filter but is not
implemented. Only the zone parameter is working.

The document http://api.openstack.org/api-ref.html#ext-os-hosts
claims that service also supportted.

The fix was add service as filter when get hosts.

Closes-Bug: #1224763

Change-Id: If46cc0c4195de685dd9365e7500fee21f84bb587

commit_message:
backing out using sphinxcontrib.programoutput

Revert to a doc only change in unit-tests.rst. Adding extension
sphinxcontrib.programoutput would require a freeze exception.
So I abandon this change for now. the ext. would allow automatic insertion
of program output.

Note: This change never made onto the master.
So the commit msg is  misleading, especially since I created mistakenly
a new change ID by using the -m flag with --amend.

Closes-Bug: 1219040
Change-Id: I4dcfaa7d563d6203ea4134b13425035634168d2f

commit_message:
Consolidate identity properties in HTTPClient

HTTPClient holds and manipulates an ever expanding list of named
arguments. Attempt to centralize this list whilst maintaining backwards
compatibility with current properties.

To maintain better adherence to the list we rename the saved property
auth_token_from_user to simply token which is how it is passed.

Change-Id: I6e1a58f8613a128aba62429f3258d1f5bff80e65
Part of: blueprint auth-plugins

commit_message:
Providing delegation of token to neutron client

Migrating changes that occurred in the Quantum client into the Neutron
client that delegates the token creation to the python neutron client.
This should enable a reduction in token creation.

The patch set merges the changes together and then updates the
corresponding unit tests.

Change-Id: I9502f9e615435ac467bde5a69208e5559556ff27
Closes-Bug: #1191159

commit_message:
Starts install guide chapter for neutron, cleanups

This begins the install guide chapter for neutron,
and cleans up some sections from the guide that will
not be used even as references.

* hypervisor_selection - not relevant for the adventure
where the choice is done prior, and makes some difficult
value judgement statemtnts

* scripted ubuntu install - not the purpose of this guide
and old content that isn't helpful for the rewrite

* image-troubleshooting - empty section, belongs in
cloud-admin-guide anyway

* vnc-console - already in image_install

* identity_config_keystone - already better done in
individual sections

* install nova-volume - very dated content, already
in cinder install

* basic install files - no longer needed for reference

Change-Id: I1979eeba091c7118db7cc30ad7c66f30345fe49d

commit_message:
Add option disable_existing_loggers for log

Current log disable all existing logger, there is no option for user
to choose. But user need this to use their own loggers and OpenStack
logger together. Add option log_disable_existing with default True

Closes-Bug: #1238349

Change-Id: Ie0ecee2543522601a9ef1dc761683bd6b3f79ddf

This is for Python 3 compatibility, since Python 3 does not support
the print statement, only the print function.  (Python 2.6 and 2.7
support both, depending on whether a __future__ import is used.)

Paths containing "xen" were left alone, because of comments in a
couple of the files indicating that the XenServer code needed to be

Fixes bug 1226943

Change-Id: I23b804a4d99500b4acf81dd19645ab06dfcc9f1c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use print function rather than print statement

This is for Python 3 compatibility, since Python 3 does not support
the print statement, only the print function.  (Python 2.6 and 2.7
support both, depending on whether a __future__ import is used.)

Paths containing "xen" were left alone, because of comments in a
couple of the files indicating that the XenServer code needed to be
compatible with Python 2.4.

Fixes bug 1226943

Change-Id: I23b804a4d99500b4acf81dd19645ab06dfcc9f1c

commit_message:
Add missing key attribute to AggregateList.get_by_host()

This simply adds the ability to pass the key attribute to the
by-host lookup for aggregates.

Related to blueprint compute-manager-objects

Change-Id: I7651bc1470845b1e3586aa3616809bdf2ef2b4a2

subject: Removed FIXME on RabbitMQ setup.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-15 00:58:02.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/ch_basics.xml'], 'message': 'Removed FIXME on RabbitMQ setup.

Installing the RabbitMQ packages on Ubuntu results in the service being
started automatically and a guest user (with password guest) being
created. No additional setup is required (at least for a basic setup).

Change-Id: I5a115a3bae49ea16f1d98dce7fa0499309dff160
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Removed FIXME on RabbitMQ setup.

Installing the RabbitMQ packages on Ubuntu results in the service being
started automatically and a guest user (with password guest) being
created. No additional setup is required (at least for a basic setup).

Change-Id: I5a115a3bae49ea16f1d98dce7fa0499309dff160

commit_message:
libvirt tests: replace assertEquals with assertEqual

In Python 2.6, both assertEqual and assertEquals are
convenience aliases to failUnlessEqual.

In Python 3, failUnlessEqual is explicitly deprecated.

This is part of blueprint assertequal

Change-Id: I1857ab4720c20df9bc9b6a06227ded4061678b16

commit_message:
Harden version checking for boto

Simple string comparison is not effective for version checking.
Let's switch to using pkg_resources.parse_version and compare
the tuples. Per review feedback, enabling the code path for
2.13 as well. Originally we had handled this by excluding
2.13 from requirements. With this we should be able to removing
the exclusion for 2.13 from global requirements.

Closes-Bug: #1239220
(cherry picked from commit eaf5636544a9b2ae1e87f74d0cdb989f8a41b008)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/test_api.py

Change-Id: Ie047f7201d8e6a9a9641000d387c4312506f49b1

commit_message:
Conditionally add dhcp-all-interfaces

If the /etc/init drectory gets created on Fedora, it causes
os-svc-daemon to add upstart init scripts instead of systemd.
As a result none of the openstack services can start.

Partial-Bug: #1239880

Change-Id: Iec317baa3eb9ff651fa66c582d2f614993cde45e

commit_message:
do_list: make "--tenant" imply "-all-tenants"

Currently, when passing "--tenant <ID>" to python-novaclient as the 'admin'
tenant, "--all-tenants" must also be explicitely passed. Without it, only the
virtual machines owned by the 'admin' tenant are listed, thus making the
'--tenant <ID>' appear useless.

This patch allows users not to pass "--all-tenants" to python-novaclient when
using "--tenant <ID>" and still get the expected behaviour.

Fixes bug #1185290

Change-Id: If767cd8b6f7646aefce362b8c6698f8bb6ecf115

This was relatively simple to fix, assuming that the image used

The use of os_type in this manner is consistent with the

commit_message:
Windows instances require the timezone to be "localtime"

This was relatively simple to fix, assuming that the image used
to boot the windows instance has the os_type set to "windows".
The use of os_type in this manner is consistent with the
existing use in the Xen hypervisor driver.

DocImpact: if you're booting windows instances, then you need to
set the os_type image property in glance to "windows". Otherwise
your instances will have their clock timezone set to UTC, which
has unexpected side effects in windows.

(cherry picked from commit 280a336a07006b2c998719f2f9033d43289ec7ef)
(cherry picked from commit 18de64748c645b32253901aa704c353e5705eadb)

Conflicts:
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

Note that the unit test had to be tweaked to work in the backport.
There are no functional changes however.

Change-Id: Id6759a290ed25c9add97ac61bb7d165b3fb908b2
Closes-Bug: 1231254

During live block migrations both pre_live_migration and
pre_block_migration check for the presence of the instance on
the destination and create the instance dir if it doesn't exist.

call and the work it does can easily be done in the existing
pre_live_migration call. In order to streamline things we

commit_message:
Check instance on dest once during block migration

During live block migrations both pre_live_migration and
pre_block_migration check for the presence of the instance on
the destination and create the instance dir if it doesn't exist.

As a result the call to pre_block_migration always fails as
pre_live_migration has already created the instance dir on the
destination.

As it turns out the pre_block_migration call is completely
unnecessary. The libvirt driver is the only driver that uses the
call and the work it does can easily be done in the existing
pre_live_migration call. In order to streamline things we
completely remove the pre_block_migration call from all
drivers. Additionally we update the function definition for
pre_live_migration to pass needed disk info down to the
virt drivers.

Fixes bug: #1193359

(cherry picked from commit 659ec75eaf052742a6269e0aae258f1c874749f7)

Conflicts:
	nova/compute/manager.py
	nova/tests/test_libvirt.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py
	nova/virt/xenapi/driver.py

Change-Id: Id9dfe482db3471d6a1b9b6c7d59a5ddc48775d7f

Beef up storage comments

commit_message:
Import six.StringIO

six.StringIO
This is an fake file object for textual data. It is an alias for
StringIO.StringIO in Python 2 and io.StringIO in Python 3.

Partial Implement: blueprint py33-support

Change-Id: I892a55eca115ec69b3104fc9d24ab589f04acc32

urlparse.parse_qsl urldecodes fields in URLs, but
the next URL and the next marker are then out of sync.
This change reverses that behavior, and also makes sure

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Quote and escape pagination markers

urlparse.parse_qsl urldecodes fields in URLs, but
the next URL and the next marker are then out of sync.
This change reverses that behavior, and also makes sure
that dots in markers are also escaped as %2e as they should be.

fixes bug #1188352

Change-Id: Idfb7b4cbd3c14bb0d34c506d7d3d5d3683735e7d

', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-09-16 15:53:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'xenapi: stop using get_all_vdis_in_sr in spawn

commit_message:
xenapi: stop using get_all_vdis_in_sr in spawn

Currently when trying to find a cached image, the very expensive call to
get_all_vdis_in_sr is used, where we could instead fetch the VDI
directly using a more targeted query.

Now we are fetching the VDI by name_label we must ensure to clear the
name_label on newly created VDIs to ensure they do not get picked up by
later calls to _find_cached_image().

Fixes bug 1221292

The above code that checks for _find_cached_images has race conditions
where its possible to end up with two VDIs returned. To stop this
happening the code to create the cached images is now synchronized on
the image being fetched.

Fixes bug 1226073

Change-Id: I534fb8f42b00b5d39dc17dd5fee297144b5f379a

commit_message:
xenapi: removes sleep after final upload retry

This change removes the sleep that happens after the final retry of
uploading an image.

This change also ensures the unit tests do not take too long by stubbing
out time.sleep.

Closes bug 1239707
Change-Id: I16b6639e3231d41fa476218f406fa5b3abdfaf71

commit_message:
set user_update policy to admin_required

This changes the default policy.json to prevent users from changing
their own attributes such as password, name, or default_project_id.

Closes-Bug: 1237989
Change-Id: I7de5fff3d72a76b78113e289c57a9fac2096395f

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-09 13:07:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add support for managing async processes

Interacting with a long-running asynchronous process requires the
use of non-blocking io.  This change adds a helper class that can
launch a long-running process and read stdout and stderr in a
non-blocking fashion via eventlet.

This functionality is intended to support monitoring ovsdb via
a long-running and root-privileged invocation of ovsdb-client.

Partial-Bug: #1177973

Change-Id: I9969e556acecf7a9e77d873371cc2ec2647be011

commit_message:
Add support for managing async processes

Interacting with a long-running asynchronous process requires the
use of non-blocking io.  This change adds a helper class that can
launch a long-running process and read stdout and stderr in a
non-blocking fashion via eventlet.

This functionality is intended to support monitoring ovsdb via
a long-running and root-privileged invocation of ovsdb-client.

The complexity of the system interaction in this patch suggested
the addition of a functional test that validated actual behaviour.
The test was added under the neutron/tests/functional path which
is now included in the testr search path.

Partial-Bug: #1177973

Change-Id: I9969e556acecf7a9e77d873371cc2ec2647be011

commit_message:
Split get_transport into 2 different functions

This patch splits get_transport into:

    - get_transport: Basic transport loading that does not depend
    on a request.
    - get_transport_for: Transport loading based on a request object.

Partially-Implements blueprint python-marconiclient-v1

Change-Id: Id1adfb3fc3d2914bf81e4b204ca3eae82a42b94d

commit_message:
Complete refactor of api.py

This patch introduces validation through jsonschema instead of using a
custom format. In order for other API versions to extend this, this
patch implements a base API under transport.api that should be extended
for every API version.

An example of this can be found in test_api.py, future patches will have
more realistic examples and extensions of this class.

The patch also moves api.py under v1/ since Api definitions are version
specific.

Partially-Implements blueprint python-marconiclient-v1

Change-Id: Ie7eacc63deeacb67edfada6ceb5c4956c5adc0b0

commit_message:
Move exception definitions out of db api

The two exceptions, NoMoreNetworks and NoMoreTargets, are defined
in nova/db/api. While NoMoreTargets is unused and can be removed,
NoMoreNetworks are still used and should be moved to exception.py
where all other exceptions live.

This came up during review of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/42980/
where compute manager would need to import nova.db to make use of
NoMoreNetworks.

Change-Id: I57f0a081d2fea35394421932ae7d2a3e67540a31

commit_message:
Handle unicode at the caching layer more elegantly

This patchset resolves an issue where in some cases unicode would
cause the cache key generator to raise a UnicodeEncodeError due to
the name/value being outside of the standard ascii character set.
Included is a fix to the cache backend debug code to utilize repr
for passing the keys/values to the logger.

Tests in test_backend provided by chenxiao <chenxiao@cn.ibm.com>

Closes-bug: 1237892
Change-Id: Ic99503987851128cd41d83ad1ea50dc4a132fbd3

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-02 04:04:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Fix quota issue where usages can drop to negative value

This is caused by an exception occuring in the model when creating
and instance. When this happens, the quota rolls back but the DB
record, created for that instance, does not.

This fix also rolls back the DB record and marks it as DELETED.
For security measures, I have also added a check that prevents
quota usages drop below 0.

Also fix a bug where the reserve quota was being set and not added.
This causes problem when multiple requests are sent at the same time
and causes race condition issues.

Fixes bug 1178333

Change-Id: I1c64941815b91e58d79b17d7a6e69c15c1daaf36

commit_message:
Fix quota issue where usages can drop to negative value

This is caused by an exception occuring in the model when creating
and instance. When this happens, the quota rolls back but the DB
record, created for that instance, does not. This issue is NOT fixed
in this patch but depends on
BP https://blueprints.launchpad.net/trove/+spec/security-groups-workflow-update

What this fix does is adds a check that prevents quota usages drop below 0.

Also it fixes a bug where the reserve quota was being set and not added.
This causes problem when multiple requests are sent at the same time
and causes race condition issues.

Fixes bug 1178333

Change-Id: I1c64941815b91e58d79b17d7a6e69c15c1daaf36
